summary: This document is the Metropolitan Correctional Center's Daily Lieutenant's Log for August 3, 2019, covering three shifts (Morning, Day, and Evening Watch). It records routine prison operations, counts, and equipment checks. The log notes an inmate (I/M) at a local hospital with USMS guards and another inmate on psychological observation with a companion, but does not name any individuals.

events.title: Daily Prison Operations and Counts
events.description: Routine prison operations including multiple inmate counts, equipment checks, body alarm tests, and religious services. An inmate was at a local hospital under USMS guard, and another was on psychological observation.

events.title: Hospital Return of Inmate
events.description: At 6:37 PM during the Evening Watch, a +1 hospital return is logged, increasing the total inmate count from 761 to 762.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
Local Hosp (referenced, likely a local hospital)
keyFacts: This log documents prison operations on August 3, 2019, the day Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased in his cell (August 10, 2019).
The log notes an inmate (I/M) at a local hospital with USMS (U.S. Marshals Service) guards and another inmate on psychological observation (Psych Obs) with an inmate companion.
No named individuals are mentioned in this routine administrative log.
The total inmate count fluctuates between 761 and 762 during the day, with specific counts for the Special Housing Unit (SHU).
The fire alarm and public address systems were reported as malfunctioning during the Day and Evening Watch shifts.
